thread.section_title: Lyft Reviews | Customer Service Reviews of Lyft | www.lyft.com | 2 of 104
thread.title: Korri Locke

author: Korri Locke
title: Korri Locke
text:
With Uber, you can become a driver within 12 to 24 hours. All they have to supply is there a drivers license, pictures of their car, Proof of insurance, and the registration. With Lyft, you have a four-day background check, a personal interview, Proof of your drivers license, insurance, and registration. So if you want to have a safe ride to get from A to B... which company do you think would be the wisest decision? I personally think it's a no-brainer.
On top of this, Lyft is an international company just the same as Uber. If you want to get in touch with Uber, you have to send them a email, and they will get in touch with you, if they want to get in touch with you. As a driver or as a passenger, there is a button on the Lyft app that says "call me". Within two seconds, no matter what time of day, a real live customer support representative will be there for you!!!!
